title: April 28
description:
On a Friday afternoon, we were surprised to receive the following email from the school:

Dear Parents,

This morning I learned that some of your children are Pastafarian (see Wikipedia), which is not a major problem except that some of them have been trying to convince children who believe in God that God doesn't exist. That brought some stress for a couple of girls. This morning I met with your children and we had a conversation on beliefs, traditions, heredity, respect and discrimination. I would appreciate if you could have a follow-up at home concerning the fact that everybody has the right to believe in whatever they want as long as they also respect others' beliefs. Thank you for your cooperation. On Monday Thierry and I we'll reconvene with your children in order to bring closure to this issue.

Have a good week-end.

We assured the school counselor we would remind Milo that the great Flying Spaghetti Monster teaches tolerance toward other religions.

children.title: FSM
children.description:
The deity of Pastafarians is the Flying Spaghetti Monster.

This parody religion made its apparition in 2005 to oppose the teaching of intelligent design and creationism in science classrooms.

Milo's friend George is the one who spread the gospel of the Flying Spaghetti Monster on the playground.

It's been a great tool to talk about religions, beliefs and tolerance.

Plus, being a Pastafarian is fun!

children.title: Grace
children.description:
Dean was surprised to discover Pastafarianism had no standard grace before eating food.

So he devised our own:

Dear Noodly Father

We thank you for this food we are about to devour
in a piratical fashion, so it please your Pastaness

Bless it to be a nourishment upon arrrr bodies

And we thank your Noodly Appendages for keeping us on the ground

In tomato sauce we pray, R'Amen

children.title: Fist Bumps
children.description:
Pastafarians have a special relationship to pirates and beer.

Colanders are their religious headgear.

children.title: Genesis
children.description: A piratical greeting from Stinson beach with other Pastafarian parents,  Tom and Renee.

children.title: Stinson
children.description:
Our day at the beach was brought to us by our friend Dean H, who threw a giant party to celebrate his 50th birthday at his beach house in Stinson Beach.

Happy Birthday Dean!

children.title: Cord On Bleu
children.description:
Meanwhile, Felix spent the weekend in Lake Berryessa at a Scout Camporee with many scout troops from the Mount Diablo Silverado Council.

Felix's patrol (the Hot Wings) won first place in the cooking competition, a.k.a. the Cord On Bleu award. They cooked sushi and spring rolls! The Hot Wings also took second place in the scout skill competition. The senior patrol from our troop won first place in the Scout Invention competition. Troop 24 took first place overall. Go Berkeley!

children.title: Woody & Chucky
children.description:
Earlier this year, Felix attended a Stop-Animation class at 4Cats Studio in Kensington. Felix and his good friend Peter were the only two kids enrolled in the class. They did it all. With the instructor's help, they wrote the plot, painted the background, created the characters out of clay, filmed the animation frame by frame and did the voice-over for the soundtrack. The studio took care of the final production. We just got a link to the final video.

Come watch it on YouTube! It's about what would happen if woodchucks could chuck wood.
